meanings.definition: To swarm or gather in large numbers.
meanings.sent1: The bees were beswarming around the hive.
meanings.sent2: The park was beswarming with families enjoying the sunny day.
meanings.sent3: The picnic area was beswarming with ants, making it a challenge to keep the food safe.
meanings.sent4: The concert hall was beswarming with excited fans, creating a buzzing atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The market square was beswarming with shoppers, creating a lively scene.

meanings.definition: To be filled or crowded with a large number of people or things.
meanings.sent1: The stadium was beswarming with cheering fans.
meanings.sent2: The classroom was beswarming with students eager to learn.
meanings.sent3: The toy store was beswarming with children excitedly browsing the shelves.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were beswarming with cars during rush hour.
meanings.sent5: The library was beswarming with book lovers, each immersed in their own world.
